page.title: 15Leisure in Wroughton
page.content: Records show that sport and leisure pursuits have been important in Wroughton since at least 1854 and even further back in 1660. Hunting, fishing and hawking have been recorded as leisure activities. Today there are many different types of recreation in Wroughton like clubs. Some examples are Cubs, Scouts, Brownies, Guides, Army cadets, Youth club, Karate, Wroughton A.S.C., Riding Stables, Dancing club and Red Cross. The prices of the clubs range from 10p to Â£3.50 at the Riding Stables. There are three playing areas in Wroughton. These areas are Maunsall Way, Weir Field and North Wroughton. The older generation has not been forgotten because we have just had a bowling green installed. There is the community centre next to the health centre at the Ellendune.
